When senior engineers do this well, it looks easy.

title: Nucleate

title: Python Workers redux: fast cold starts, packages, and a uv-first workflow
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-11, Reading time: 9 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblog.cloudflare.com%2Fpython-workers-advancements%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019b0d5ca5de-62979e4f-f0b9-4269-bb6b-90eea6df874e-000000/ukSvf0j1r1UE8Elh2oZNu76WFO7Alf8eqhbjBuTS1H8=435
summary: Python Workers redux: fast cold starts, packages, and a uv-first workflow (9 minute read) Python Workers allow Python developers to ship Python globally in less than two minutes in a single command. Python Workers now supports any package supported by Pyodide, the WebAssembly runtime that powers Python Workers. It also now has dedicated memory snapshots to reduce cold start times. This post shares some of the technical details behind the changes.
